1.text: Draw some outer space designs on your black cardstock sheet.

2.text: Cut out the lid of the cardboard box your kit came in.
2.vid: /f/f7/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 2 Version 3.360p.mp4

3.text: Glue the cardstock sheet to the box lid to make a game board.
3.vid: /a/a5/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 3 Version 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Cut out 14 small pieces of silver tissue paper with scissors.
4.vid: /5/59/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 4 Version 3.360p.mp4

5.text: Wrap 7 mini magnets in silver tissue to make asteroids.
5.vid: /d/d0/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 5 Version 3.360p.mp4

6.text: Crumple up 7 more pieces of tissue to make asteroids without magnets.
6.vid: /7/72/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 6 Version 3.360p.mp4

7.text: Stick a mini magnet into each rocket eraser.
7.vid: /8/80/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 7 Version 3.360p.mp4

8.text: Twist a tiny eyehook screw into the top of each rocket.
8.vid: /6/65/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 8 Version 3.360p.mp4

9.text: Tie a string onto each eyehook screw.
9.vid: /4/4c/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 9 Version 3.360p.mp4

10.text: Attach the other end of each string to a craft stick.
10.vid: /0/01/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 10 Version 3.360p.mp4

11.text: Spread the asteroids out on the game board.
11.vid: /6/60/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 11 Version 3.360p.mp4

12.text: Swing the rockets over the board to try and catch the asteroids.
12.vid: /1/16/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 12 Version 3.360p.mp4

13.text: Try to catch as many asteroids as you can in 10 seconds.
13.vid: /a/a7/Make an Asteroid Catching Game Step 13 Version 3.360p.mp4
